feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 12:04PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 21 at 11:01PM MST until August 21 at 11:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MST/1130 PM PDT/ FOR CENTRAL LA PAZ AND RIVERSIDE COUNTIES... At 1101 PM MST/1101 PM PDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Big River to 17 miles west of Bouse to 7 miles east of Quartzsite to 6 miles southeast of Brenda, moving southwest at 35 mph.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 10:12PM MST until August 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 1012 PM MST, Heavy rainfall continues across Kingman and Golden Valley with flooding reported. Heaviest rainfall has occured in the Hualapai Mountains where numerous roads have been closed by flood waters. Additional flooding has occured in Golden Valley.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 9:17PM MST until August 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River near Solomon from 21 to 20.5 ft.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 21 at 7:56PM HST until August 22 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST MONDAY FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS... .A south-southwest swell (190 degrees) has built larger than expected late this afternoon and evening, leading to advisory level surf for south facing shores. The large surf will continue into Monday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 1:44AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog This Morning... Patchy dense fog is expected along and near the coast this morning with locally poor visibility. Visibility may be reduce to one quarter mile at times. If you have travel plans, be aware that the visibility may drop rapidly over short distances. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 10:40PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area overnight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms becoming scattered in the eastern mountain zones during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is expected over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Other

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 9:00PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Thunderstorm chances will increase over southeast Washington late tonight into Monday. This will carry the potential for abundant lightning with limited moisture. This will increase the potential for fire starts. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE WAZ709...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 11:03PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG MAY POSE A HAZARD TO MOTORISTS EARLY MONDAY MORNING... Patchy dense fog is expected to develop across the area during the early morning hours. The fog could reduce the visibility to less than 1/4 mile in places, resulting in locally hazardous travel conditions.
